001package Filters;
002import java.util.Random;
003
004import ij.ImagePlus;
005import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
006import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
007import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
008import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
009
010/**
011 * Jitter filter implemented with 'ImageAccessor' for transparent
012 * image access.
013 * Works for all image types, using nearest-border-pixel strategy.
014 * The input image is destructively modified.
015 * 
016 * @author wilbur
017 * @version 2016/11/01
018 */
019public class Jitter_Filter_ImageAccessor implements PlugInFilter {
020        
021        final int rad = 3;      // the radius (should be user-specified)
022        
023        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
024                return DOES_ALL;
025        }
026
027        public void run(ImageProcessor ip1) {
028                final int w = ip1.getWidth();
029                final int h = ip1.getHeight();
030                final int d = 2 * rad + 1;      // width/height of the "kernel"
031                
032                ImageProcessor ip2 = ip1.duplicate();
033                ImageAccessor ia1 = ImageAccessor.create(ip1);
034                ImageAccessor ia2 = ImageAccessor.create(ip2, OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder, null);
035
036                Random rnd = new Random();
037                
038                for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
039                        for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
040                                int rx = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
041                                int ry = rnd.nextInt(d) - rad;
042                                // pick a random position inside the current support region
043                                float[] p = ia2.getPix(u + rx, v + ry);
044                                // replace the current center pixel
045                                ia1.setPix(u, v, p);
046                        }
047                }
048                
049                ia2 = null;
050                ip2 = null;
051        }
052        
053}
